playlist_videos.title: How to make a Christmas Fairy! üéÑüßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è | CBeebies House
playlist_videos.description:
Christmas crafts from CBeebies üëâ https://bbc.in/37yBHSK

Get in the festive spirit with these easy Christmas crafts from CBeebies!

Make a Christmas Fairy
Watch this video as Evie shows you how to make your own Christmas fairy.

You will need
Sticky tape Glue Scissors (grown-up use only) Two cupcake cases Coloured card One pompom Pipe cleaners Ribbon A plate Pencil or pen

Step One:
Put a plate on some card and draw around the plate with a pencil or pen.

Step Two:
With a grown-ups help, cut the circle out with scissors.

Step Three:
Fold the circle in half and cut to make two semi-circles.

Step Four:
Roll up one of the semi circles to make a cone shape and use sticky tape to keep it in place.

Step Five:
Fold a cupcake case in half to make a semi circle and use glue to stick it to your cone. These are your fairy wings.

Step Six:
Stick a pipe cleaner to a pompom using glue. Then stick the pompom to the top of the cone.

Step Seven:
Make a loop with your ribbon. Then using stick tape, stick the ribbon to the back of your fairy.

Visit us at http://www.bbc.co.uk/cbeebies

playlist_videos.description:
Find out more! 
üëâ https://www.bbc.co.uk/cbeebies/grownups/cbeebies-christmas-show-2020

Yodel along with the yodelling Yeti and the Delivery Elf! For more fun songs from the CBeebies Christmas In Storyland head over to BBC iPlayer!

Christmas in Storyland

CBeebies will be spreading some festive magic this December with the return of the much loved annual Christmas Show. Christmas in Storyland is set in an enchanting world, featuring a cast of CBeebies favourites, upbeat songs and dances and a range of characters including a yodelling Yeti and singing sea creatures to bring much welcomed Christmas joy to living rooms across the UK.

It follows the tale of Dillydally the Delivery Elf, played by Andy Day and his boss Head Elf Jiffy, played by Jennie Dale, as they set out on a quest to deliver a stocking full of Christmas goodies. Their journey will take them deep under the ocean, high up to castles in the clouds, via the solar system and through the snow-capped mountains. The show is narrated by nine year old Taiya Samuel, who voices JoJo in the CBeebies favourite, JoJo & Gran Gran. Take a look at our cast reveal to find out more about the characters. 

How to watch the show

Christmas in Storyland will be available to watch on Saturday 12 December on the CBeebies channel and BBC iPlayer.

Visit us at http://www.bbc.co.uk/cbeebies

Series 4: 30. The Cinema Badge.

The Squirrels are excited to attend the cinema together for the first time with Duggee, who teaches them that you should adhere to three rules in order for everyone to enjoy the experience: stay quiet, don‚Äôt fidget or kick the chair in front and go to the toilet before the film starts. 
The Squirrels quickly learn that the short films they are enjoying are only trailers before the film starts. Hopefully, the Squirrels can maintain their focus in order to watch the film all the way through to the end credits and earn their cinema badges.

Series 4: 40. The Imagination Badge

The Squirrels have played with all their toys, and they are frustrated because they feel they have nothing left to do. Duggee tells them that there‚Äôs always limitless fun if you use your imagination. He explains that you can use your mind to pretend to do or be anything you want and demonstrates how he can imagine he‚Äôs a dancer or even a horse. 
The Squirrels take turns thinking of what they want to be or what they want to do. At first, not everyone gets the hang of it, but soon enough, they all embark on their greatest adventure yet, in the new world they have imagined. Together, they can speed through space or float through an underwater world, where Norrie is a rock star and Tag can be king. All that immersive fun can happen just from the clubhouse! When the Squirrels search for Enid, they are surprised to hear her meow from the top of the Mighty Sugar Bun Mountain. The Squirrels prepare for the climb to rescue Enid, but first Duggee teaches them what they need to pack in their backpacks for a successful trip. 

The team walk through rocky terrain, grey skies, plentiful rain and snow blizzards but keep morale high as they learn how phrasing negative thoughts into helpful ones will let them overcome any challenges along the way. The Squirrels repeat their positive affirmations to keep climbing up the Sugar Bun as a team, and when they find themselves at the top of the mountain, they all give Enid a big hug. A successful rescue mission means Happy can have his nap on the sofa with Enid when they are back! Watch full episodes of Hey Duggee on BBC iPlayer!

Hey Duggee | The Days of the Week Badge | CBeebies

The Squirrels are excited to learn that Mr Wobbly, the jelly juggler, is coming to town, and they can‚Äôt wait to see him. But they become impatient, so Duggee makes sure to explain to them that the week will fly by and there‚Äôs a lot to be done in that time. Duggee explains that a week is made up of seven days and what activities he does each day to stay busy. Each squirrel excitedly shares their usual plans between Monday and Friday so that they have something to look forward to while they wait for Mr Wobbly‚Äôs arrival.

playlist_videos.title: Hey Duggee | The Squirrels' First Day of School | CBeebies
playlist_videos.description:
üì∫Watch CBeebies full episodes on BBC iPlayer https://www.bbc.co.uk/tv/cbeebies
‚ù§Ô∏èSubscribe to CBeebies YouTube Channel https://bbc.in/2INIaAT 

Nervous about going to school? Don't worry, everyone starts somewhere, in this super compilation we see all five members of The Squirrel Club - Norrie, Roly, Happy, Tag and Betty on their first days with Duggee. You can watch full episodes of Hey Duggee on BBC iPlayer. 

00:00 - Norrie's First Day

Series 4, Episode 1 - Norrie skips into the Clubhouse and greets her friends. Together, they reflect on their first meeting. 

Arriving with her parents in a long limousine, Norrie, her parents and her 72 siblings flood out of the car. It's just Norrie who is going to stay at the Clubhouse, though, and enjoy some well-needed quiet. She can play alone and hear herself think! But after a while, she misses the hustle and bustle, so Duggee introduces Norrie to Enid the cat. Together, they venture into the Clubhouse, and Norrie has a friend so she isn't alone, but she still has a little bit more room than she would have at home! 

03:00 - Roly's First Day

Series 4, Episode 3 - As Roly makes his usual noise in the Clubhouse, Duggee and the Squirrels reminisce about how completely different Roly was when he first arrived. Hiding behind his dad, Roly wasn't loud at all but impossibly quiet! 

As Duggee shows Roly around the Clubhouse, he squeals, hides and hangs off his dad, and just seems altogether too shy to fit in. Duggee has a great idea to introduce Roly to Norrie, thinking a friend will help him to settle in. But Roly is still too shy, so Duggee and Norrie start doing things with him, knowing this will help him to embrace the fun of the Clubhouse. While painting, playing with balloons and yelling, Roly begins to truly find his voice and be himself! Soon, Roly hardly noticed if his dad was around at all.

06:07 - Happy's First Day 

Series 4, Episode 5 - Happy has always loved the water - even though it makes a mess! But while swimming around in his paddling pool at the playhouse, Duggee reminds the Squirrels that there was a time when Happy feared water. 

09:15 - Tag's First Day 

Series 4, Episode 7 - The Squirrels are crafting in the Clubhouse when Betty saves Tag from throwing water across the table instead of glitter. We learn quickly that Tag, although full of enthusiasm and energy, has not always been the best listener. He was great at discovering new things, and everyone wanted to join in with him - but getting easily distracted would land him in an array of trouble. 

12:20 - Betty's First Day

Series 4, Episode 9 - The Squirrels are having fun playing games but are surprised to find out that Betty didn‚Äôt always enjoy playing. 

Since her first day at Squirrel Club, she always impressed everyone with her confidence and independence, but at first she didn‚Äôt know how to join in with the others. Luckily, Duggee had a great idea to bring all the Squirrels together.

Hey Duggee and the Squirrels gain 4 sport badges in this super sporty compilation. You can watch full episodes of Hey Duggee on BBC iPlayer.

Series 1, Episode 40 - The Football Badge
Duggee and the Squirrels decide to play football. Duggee starts the game by kicking the ball to the Squirrels, who look at it blankly. They don't know what to do - they've never played football before. Worm, Hennie and Ethel do their best to show them the rules, but it's all going in the wrong direction. How will they ever score a goal?

Series 3, Episode 46 - The Training Badge
Duggee struggles to organise the Squirrels in order of height and keep them focused on the task. Sounds like the Squirrels need some training to improve their concentration.

Series 3, Episode 20 - The Crazy Golf Badge
Duggee and the Squirrels practice their golf swing in some interesting conditions in pursuit of their Crazy Golf Badges and the ultimate prize - a round of milkshakes! 

Series 2, Episode 26 - The Obstacle Course Badge 
It's time for the annual Animal Obstacle Course Race. The animals need to work together in teams to complete the course. Duggee has his obstacle course badge. He and the Squirrels form the RED team and the fun begins.

Happy has always loved the water! Even though it makes a mess! But swimming around in his paddling pool at the playhouse, Duggee reminds the Squirrels there was a time when Happy feared water.
On Happy‚Äôs first day, his mum drops him off and he is excited. He goes to play with Norrie and Roly and has loads of fun. Baking, playing with toys, jumping over puddles.... Oh wait Happy can‚Äôt do it! He‚Äôs terrified of water. Now everywhere he looks there‚Äôs water!

Sing along to the Hey Duggee Christmas with Duggee, the Squirrels and all their friends. Sing along with the Hey Duggee Christmas song lyrics below. 

It comes only once a year,
But stays in the heart so near.

The warmth we spread,
The food we share,
Families held so close,
When they aren't there.

Santa's sleigh up above,
Visiting the one's you love.

All at peace,
Wait and see,
What is waiting under the Christmas tree.

Christmas is the time with,
The ones we love,
Full of cheer,
And Duggee hugs.
Remembering all the, 
Times we've shared,
And wishing all the peace that finds us here.

The stars above,
Shine so bright,
Shining on this Christmas night.
I wish we may,
I wish we might,
Share this moment here tonight.

Christmas!
Time for caring.
Christmas! 
Time for sharing.

So just remember Squirrels, 
Hold the ones you love close, 
Be generous, 
Be kind,
For it is a very special time.
Christmas comes but once a year, 
But duggee hugs are always near!

Santa's sleigh up above,
Visiting the one's you love.

All at peace,
Wait and see,
What is waiting under the Christmas tree.

Merry Christmas Squirrels!

Five Little Squirrels played golf one day,
And earned their Crazy Golf Badge, yay!

Then Duggee said "A Woof woof woof!"
And all four Squirrels had a Duggee hug.

Then Happy went home, and that left 1, 2, 3 Squirrels!

Three Little Squirrels went sailing one day,
And earned their Sailing Badge that day.
Then Duggee said "A Woof woof woof!"
And all three Squirrels had a Duggee hug.

Then Roly went home, see you Roly!

Two Little Squirrels went digging one day,
And earned their Fossil Badge that day.
Then Duggee said "A Woof woof woof!"
And Betty and Tag had a Duggee hug.

Then Tag went home, and things got quieter at The Squirrel Club!

One Little Squirrel was quiet one day,
She earned her Being Quiet Badge, yay!
Then Duggee said "A Woof woof woof!"
And Dugge gave Betty a Duggee Hug.

And then it was time for Betty to go home.

See you next time! A woof-woof!

playlist_videos.title: Numberblocks One, Two, Three, Four and Five! | Start Your Counting Journey on BBC iPlayer | CBeebies
playlist_videos.description:
üì∫Watch CBeebies full episodes on BBC iPlayer https://www.bbc.co.uk/tv/cbeebies
‚ù§Ô∏èSubscribe to CBeebies YouTube Channel https://bbc.in/2INIaAT 

Meet Numberblocks One, Two, Three, Four and Five with their special introduction songs. You can watch full episodes of Numberblocks on BBC iPlayer. 

00:00 One
01:03 Two
02:10 Three
03:11 Four
04:16 Five

Series 1, Episode 1 - One
A little block falls out of the sky, meets her numberling and discovers one wonderful world, singing and counting to one. Learn all about the number 1 with Numberblock One!

Series 1, Episode 3 - Two
Two finds a pair of magic dancing shoes and shows One that everything is better with two, singing and counting things that belong in pairs. Learn all about the number two with Numberblock Two.

Series 1, Episode 4 - Three
Three arrives with a bang and a song-and-dance about her favourite number - 1, 2, 3, Everybody Look at Me! Learn all about the number three with Numberblock Three.

Series 1, Episode 6 - Four
The animated adventures of friends who can always count on each other. Four is the new block on the block and he can't wait to share how much he loves to be square. 

Series 1, Episode 7 - Five
The animated adventures of friends who can always count on each other. Five arrives to get the band together, and the party started, with a big high five. 

You can find full episodes of Numberblocks on BBC iPlayer!

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes. 

#CBeebies #numberblocks #iplayer #songs #preschool #preschoolsongs #numbersongs #numbersong

playlist_videos.title: James Norton Reads 'How to Manage a Mammoth' | CBeebies Bedtime Stories
playlist_videos.description:
üì∫Watch CBeebies full episodes on BBC iPlayer https://www.bbc.co.uk/tv/cbeebies
‚ù§Ô∏èSubscribe to CBeebies YouTube Channel https://bbc.in/2INIaAT 

James Norton Reads 'How to Manage a Mammoth' | CBeebies Bedtime Stories

James Norton is here to read us a Bedtime Story. Listen along as he reads 'How to Manage a Mammoth', written by Dr. Rose Stewart and illustrated by Richard Dwyer.
This story is about a boy called Jake, who's 'Diabetes Mammoth' becomes a little too much for him sometimes. Follow along as he discovers ways to make his mammoth smaller, and strengthen the bond with his mum as he goes.

James has also shared his tips and advice, for parents whose child has received a diabetes diagnosis, via BBC Bitesize:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/articles/zmtr7v4

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes. 

#JamesNorton #Diabetes #DiabetesAwarenessWeek #DrRoseStewart #RichardDwyer #HowtoManageaMammoth #CBeebies #BedtimeStories

Zayn Malik Reads 'Music Is In Everything' | CBeebies Bedtime Stories

Zayn Malik joins us for a Bedtime Story. Listen as he reads 'Music Is In Everything'', written by Ziggy Marley and illustrated by Ag Jatkowska.
This story is a picture book celebrating the joy of music all around us. From the sound of sea waves to laughter and dancing in the family kitchen, music really is in everything!

Eurovision's Olly Alexander reads "Perfectly Norman" | CBeebies Bedtime Stories

Eurovision's UK star, Olly Alexander, joins us for a Bedtime Story. Listen along as he reads 'Perfectly Norman', written and illustrated by Tom Percival. This story is all about Norman, a perfectly normal boy, who one day, grew an extraordinary pair of wings. He loved his new wings, until he started to worry about how other people would feel about his amazing talent.

Lora Fachie reads tonight's bedtime story, The Black Book of Colours.

Written by: Menena Cottin 
Illustrated by: Rosana Faria

A visually impaired boy introduces us to colours as he experiences them ‚Äì through his senses of hearing, touch, smell and taste - for example, yellow tastes like mustard but is as soft as feathers.

It is hard to imagine how someone who is not sighted experiences the world, and this remarkable book certainly helps to broaden horizons and challenge some assumptions. Every page is black to avoid distraction, with the text brought to life by the tactile pictures, braille and of course the power of language and imagination.

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

But for Tilly, sitting around waiting to be rescued by a prince is BORING. So ‚Ä¶ Tilly simply rescues herself! ‚ÄúThis puny prison can‚Äôt hold me!‚Äù And it‚Äôs not long before word of Tilly‚Äôs exploits spreads across the kingdom and inspires other princesses to take their fate into their own hands, too.

Rose Ayling-Ellis signs tonight's bedtime story, Can Bears Ski?

Written by Raymond Antrobus
Illustrated by Polly Dunbar

Strictly Come Dancing's, Rose Ayling-Ellis uses British Sign Language to sign tonight's bedtime story about a little bear who is deaf and is struggling to understand the world around him.

A little bear wakes up in the morning, gets dressed and has his breakfast, and then Dad walks him to school. All morning, he keeps thinking that people are asking him ‚ÄúCan bears ski?‚Äù ‚Äì it‚Äôs confusing. Why would they keep asking that?

When he gets to school, Little Bear doesn‚Äôt quite follow what his friend has said at lunch that everyone else finds so funny, and he‚Äôs not sure what Teacher Bear asks him either.

After school, Dad picks the Little Bear up and they go and see an audiologist who does some tests, and fits Little Bear with some hearing aids. Suddenly the world is very loud indeed! Perhaps people haven‚Äôt been asking him ‚ÄúCan bears ski?‚Äù after all ‚Äì perhaps it was ‚ÄúCan you hear me?‚Äù And when Dad reads a bedtime story, Little Bear can finally appreciate what he was missing before.

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes. 

#CBeebies #BedtimeStories #Strictly #RoseAylingEllis #BSL #ReadAlong

Chris Hemsworth reads tonight's bedtime story Stormy Night.

Steve Carrell reads tonight's Bedtime Story, The Eyebrows of Doom.

Dave the bear is sweeping up in his cave one day, when two slugs covered in hair proclaim themselves as the Eyebrows of Doom and jump onto Dave‚Äôs face. Somehow, they seem to have a terrible power over Dave, and make him jump all over some nearby campers‚Äô tents, as well as eating all their food.

Yet, Dave‚Äôs antics aren‚Äôt enough for the Eyebrows of Doom, and they jump onto Ron the seagull, making him poop all over some nearby holidaymakers ‚Äì and persuade a sweet little girl to stuff her ice cream down the back of her grampa‚Äôs trousers. Enough is enough! Who will be able to defeat the Eyebrows of Doom? And will their efforts be enough?

Written by Steve Smallman
Illustrated by Miguel Ordonez

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

Mr Tumble reads and Makaton signs tonight's bedtime story, Be A Friend. 

Dennis is an ordinary boy who expresses himself in extraordinary ways. Some children shout, some children sing, Dennis mimes. But being a mime is lonely. When Dennis meets a girl named Joy, he begins to discover the power of friendship and how special it can be.Be A Friend subtly explores the world of children with autism and language barriers in an engaging and accessible way.

Written and illustrated by Salina Yoon.

Gok Wan reads tonight's bedtime story, My Mum is a Lioness. 

A hilarious tale about a mum who is a strong, confident lioness figure to her young son who has a wild imagination. Run! Hide! My mum's a lioness and she's on the prowl.

Is Mum a lioness? She loves her 'cubs', she can run faster than anything, and she can catch you in a single pounce for cuddles and kisses. She always makes sure you can hear her incredibly loud, proud roar. What else could Mum be but a lioness?

But sometimes, especially when her young ones are upset or scared, a lovely, warm, protective lioness embrace is just what is needed.

Written by Swapna Haddow
Illustrated by Dapo Adeola

Ed Sheeran reads the CBeebies Bed Time Story 'I Talk Like A River' written by poet Jordan Scott and illustrated by Sydney Smith. Ed Sheeran tells the story of a boy with a stutter, who feels isolated and alone, until a walk by the river helps him find his voice.

British Olympian, Alice Dearing reads tonight's bedtime story, Tomorrow I'll Be Brave.

Tomorrow I'll be all the things I tried to be today: Adventurous, Strong, Smart, Curious, Creative, Confident, & Brave. And if I wasn't one of them, I know that it's OK. Journey through a world filled with positive and beautifully hand-lettered words of wisdom, inspiration, and motivation. As this book reminds you, tomorrow is another day, full of endless opportunities - all you have to do is decide to make the day yours.

David Schwimmer, best known for his role as Ross Geller in US sit-com Friends (and has recently come back together for the Friends Reunion) reads If I Had A Sleepy Sloth, written by Gabby Dawnay and illustrated by Alex Barrow.

Comedian Romesh Ranganathan, who has his own show The Ranganation on @BBC and often stars in, Sky One's A League of Their Own ( ALOTO ) reads I Want My Hat Back, written and illustrated by Jon Klassen.

Former Take That band member and now solo artist Robbie Williams reads Jazz Dog written and illustrated by Marie Voigt.

Strictly Come Dancing winner and television presenter Ore Oduba reads Don't Spill The Milk, written by Stephen Davies, illustrated by Christopher Corr.

Queens of the Stone Age front man, Josh Homme reads Zog, written by Julia Donaldson, illustrated by Axel Scheffler.

Legend Tom Hardy, from Peaky Blinders reads Hug Me, written and illustrated by Simona Ciraolo.

Lord of the Rings actor, Orlando Bloom, who has a daughter with Katy Perry reads We Are Together, written and illustrated by Britta Teckentrup.

X Factor presenter Dermot O'Leary reads My Daddy is Hilarious, written by Gavin Puckett, illustrated by Chris Jevons.

Singer, songwriter Will Young, who became famous after winning XFactor reads, Two Dads, written by Carolyn Robertson, illustrated by Sophie Humphreys.

JLS singer JB Gill who now is established in the farming world and has his own CBeebies show, Down On The Farm reads Ah-Choo, written by Lana Wayne Koehler and Gloria Adams, illustrated by Ken Min.

Body Coach and your go to work out or pe with Joe Wicks reads Would You Like a Banana? written and illustrated by Yasmeen Ismail.

McFly's front man Tom Fletcher, who is married to Giovanna Fletcher reads Daddy's Sandwich, written by Pip Jones, illustrated by Laura Hughes.

Football pundit, Chris Kamara, who will no doubt be ahuge part of the upcoming Euro 2020 / Euro 2021 reads Kicking a Ball, written by Allan Ahlberg, illustrated by Sebastien Braun.

Justin Fletcher aka Mr Tumble reads tonight's bedtime story, I Dare You Not To Yawn. 

A cautionary tale about the consequences of that most contagious of conditions: yawning. A yawn can land you in your pj‚Äôs and under the covers before you can blink and say "Baa baa black sheep." So clamp your mouth shut and look away from your sleepy dog, stay away from your cuddly blanket, and whatever you do, don‚Äôt think of baby orangutans stretching their long arms out for a snuggly hug. Otherwise, you might find your mouth opening wide and letting out a great big yawny yaaaaaawn ‚Äî hey, you were supposed hold it in! 

Written by Helene Boudreau
Illustrated by Serge Bloch

CBeebies, Mr Tumble is reading tonight's bedtime story, The Gingerbread Man.

Run, run, as fast as you can! Can any body catch the gingerbread man? The Gingerbread Man Story is a classic children's story about a runaway gingerbread man fleeing from the woman who baked him. The story is best known for the gingerbread man's catchphrase "Run, run, as fast you can! You can't catch me I'm the gingerbread man!"

Retold by Louise Martin
Illustrated by Gail Yerrill

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

Comedian Romesh Ranganathan reads tonight's bedtime story, I Want My Hat Back. 

A bear sets out in search of his missing hat. Along the way, he asks all the animals he meets if any of them have seen his hat. They all say no‚Ä¶ But just as it he begins to lose hope, lying flat on his back in despair, a deer comes by and asks a rather obvious question that suddenly sparks the bear's memory and renews his search with a vengeance.

Tom Hardy reads tonight's bedtime story, There's a Tiger in the Garden. 

When Grandma says she's seen a tiger in the garden, Nora doesn't believe her. She's too old to play Grandma's silly games! Everyone knows that tigers live in jungles, not gardens. So even when Nora sees butterflies with wings as big as her arm, and plants that try and eat her toy giraffe, and a polar bear that likes fishing, she knows there's absolutely, DEFINITELY no way there could be a tiger in the garden ...Could there? 

Written and Illustrated by Lizzy Stewart 

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

CBeebies, Andy Day reads tonight's bedtime story, Oddsockosaurus. 

This book captures the imagination of a whimsical little boy who describes some of his very human characteristics as if he were a dinosaur. Referring to himself as a Fastosaurus Rex, Whyceratops, Readabookadocus, Tellafibasaurus, Muddyraptor, and many others, he explains why he can be all these different dinosaurs, and why if dinosaurs were still around, they would understand him quite well!

Friends star, David Schwimmer reads tonight's bedtime story, If I Had A Sleepy Sloth. 

In this charming trip of the imagination, a little girl delights in experiencing life at a slower pace as she shares her day with a sleepy sloth who moves so slowly, moss grows in his fur!  This sloth may be sleepy but it's a champion on the jungle gym, thanks to its super gripping skills. And climbing trees has never been so easy! But the little girl's hairdresser is less than impressed to find not just moss but also moths in its fur - and by the time our sleepy sloth has finished its morning walk, the day is almost done.

Written by Gabby Dawnay
Illustrated by Alex Barrow

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

CBeebies Mr Tumble reads tonight's bedtime story, While We Can't Hug. An adorable story about how to show someone you love them whilst maintaining social distancing.  

Hedgehog and Tortoise were the best of friends. They wanted to give each other a great, big hug. But they weren't allowed to touch. "Don't worry," said Owl. "There are lots of ways to show someone you love them." So the two friends wave to each other, blow kisses, sing songs, dance around and write letters. And even though they can't hug and they can't touch, they both know that they are loved. 

Written by Eoin McLaughlin
Illustrated by Polly Dunbar

CBeebies is dedicated to delighting and surprising its pre-school audience and it remains the UK's most watched and most loved channel for the under-sixes.

Broadway singer Idina Menzel reads tonight's bedtime story, A Robin's Winter Song.

The forest was bustling with activity. As the red and orange leaves swirled in the wind, Robin started to worry. Something was changing. Finch was flying south, because Winter was coming. Squirrel was burying food, because Winter was coming. Even Owl was making his nest warm. Why? That's right - because Winter was coming. Robin decided he didn't like the sound of Winter one little bit. But that was before the snow ... 

Written and illustrated by Suzanne Barton.
